product_overview: A responsive and engaging web application dedicated to promoting and educating users about freediving. It features dynamic visual elements like parallax and kinetic typography, a smooth scroll experience, detailed freediving course listings, a gallery of diving moments, and integrated surveys to gauge user feedback.
core_goals: Provide an immersive and smooth user experience with modern UI features such as kinetic typography, parallax backgrounds, and smooth scrolling.
Offer comprehensive educational content about freediving, including philosophy, statistics, and available courses.
Enable user engagement through interactive features such as surveys and image galleries.
Ensure accessibility and responsiveness across devices and screen sizes.
Maintain consistent design system usage to improve maintainability and visual coherence.
key_features: Responsive navigation bar that adapts to scroll and screen size with improved accessibility and potential hamburger menu support for mobile devices.
Hero section with parallax background, kinetic typography, and floating decorative elements to create a dynamic first impression.
Intro section explaining the philosophy and essential information about freediving.
Statistics section highlighting key freediving metrics to educate users effectively.
Courses section listing available freediving courses with detailed information to assist user decision-making.
Gallery section showcasing freediving moments to engage and inspire users visually.
Contact section providing contact details and communication forms for user inquiries.
Footer component containing relevant links and copyright information.
Custom cursor that replaces the default cursor, designed to integrate well with all interactive elements and accessible states.
Survey system allowing users to participate and view results to gather feedback and increase engagement.
Smooth scrolling and footer reveal implemented via Lenis for an enhanced browsing experience.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the homepage; they are greeted by an engaging hero section with smooth scrolling and kinetic typography.
User navigates through different sections like Intro, Stats, Courses, Gallery, and Contact via the responsive navigation bar.
User explores detailed course offerings and views statistical insights about freediving.
User interacts with the gallery to view freediving images.
User completes surveys to provide feedback and reviews survey results.
User accesses contact information or submits inquiries through the contact form.
User experiences a consistent UI with custom cursor and responsive design across devices.
User footer visibility is smoothly managed to enhance overall experience.
validation_criteria: Navigation bar responds correctly to scroll events and adapts to different screen sizes, including mobile devices with a functional hamburger menu.
All color schemes, spacing, fonts, and other style tokens strictly adhere to the design system without hardcoded values.
Inline styles are refactored into CSS classes or modules to improve maintainability and performance.
Custom cursor functions correctly across all interactive elements and does not hinder accessibility or keyboard navigation.
Images, including hero backgrounds, are optimized for web (e.g., WebP format) and load efficiently without blocking the rendering.
Accessibility standards are met, including proper alt attributes on images, visible focus rings during keyboard navigation, and overall usability.
Survey components load properly, accept user input, and display results accurately.
No broken links or missing assets exist, including favicon and asset references.
Responsive layouts are tested across multiple device sizes to ensure no visual or functional regressions.
